Red-Flag Words / Phrases: Adjusted, Normalized, Underlying, Pro forma, Excluding one-time items, Non-recurring, Before exceptional items
Why It Gets Flagged: Often used to mask weak core performance or inflate profitability

Red-Flag Words / Phrases: Liquidity management, Cash conservation, Optimizing cash flows, Deferred payments, Refinancing, Roll-over of facilities
Why It Gets Flagged: Indicates stress in cash generation and dependence on short-term funding

Red-Flag Words / Phrases: Covenant compliance, Waiver obtained, Renegotiated terms, Revised repayment schedule, Deleveraging initiatives
Why It Gets Flagged: Signals lender pressure or weakening balance sheet strength

Red-Flag Words / Phrases: Exceptional items, Extraordinary expense, Impairment, Restructuring cost, Provision reversal, One-time charge
Why It Gets Flagged: Repeated usage suggests recurring losses being classified as non-recurring

Red-Flag Words / Phrases: Change in accounting policy, Revised estimates, Management judgement, Assumptions, Fair value adjustment
Why It Gets Flagged: Earnings can shift materially due to subjective assumptions

Red-Flag Words / Phrases: Ongoing proceedings, Show-cause notice, Regulatory review, Contingent liability, No material impact expected
Why It Gets Flagged: Potential hidden future liabilities or penalties

Red-Flag Words / Phrases: Management expects, Management believes, Plans to explore, Evaluating options, Strategic alternatives
Why It Gets Flagged: Vague forward-looking language replacing hard numbers

Red-Flag Words / Phrases: Other segment, Residual, Corporate expenses, Reclassification, Restated figures
Sustainability focus, Long-term value creation, Responsible growth, Net-zero ambition
Why It Gets Flagged: May distract from weak financial fundamentals

Red-Flag Words / Phrases: May, Could, Might, Expected to, Aims to, As appropriate, Where necessary
